Docs.summary: Implements a structure that is used to describe the of an object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks is particularly useful because it describes both the and of an object. is used extensively by the layout system to arrange and measure elements. ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *width* A value greater than or equal to 0 that specifies the of the structure. *height* A value greater than or equal to 0 that specifies the of the structure. ## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use a structure in code. remarks.format: ## Remarks Even if <xref:System.Windows.Size> is 0, the instance of <xref:System.Windows.Size> will still contain a 0 or 1, indicating a zero- or one-dimensional set of points. Therefore, do not use this property to check for a 0 area.

Docs.summary: Returns a that represents this object.
Docs.returns: A that specifies the width followed by the height.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.Windows.Size.Width%2A> property is set to 30 and the <xref:System.Windows.Size.Height%2A> property is set to 40, the <xref:System.Windows.Size.ToString%2A> method returns a string that says `"30, 40"`.
